Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2011 03:15PM mjsdad wrote: Thanks again for the PM's and the encouragement, this info needs to be everywhere ...
Posts.Title: For mjsmom: MRI options IMPORTANT mjsdad donnabee

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2011 10:13AM mjsdad wrote: One month has passed ... Here is her obituary: http://www.legacy.com/obituaries/azcentral/obituary.aspx?n=marilyn-ann-rohn-vaughn&pid=152796645 REMEMBER: CONTRAST MRI's ...
Posts.Title: For mjsmom: MRI options IMPORTANT mjsdad donnabee

Posts.Content: mjsdad wrote: MRI without contrast and MRI WITH contrast   Apparently there are two types.   INSIST on the contrast method, things get "missed" on the non-contrast method   shout it from the rooftops, we could still have her if the proper MRI's were done    mjsmom had a full brain MRI last September and was given the "all clear"   fast forward to a week and a half ago when she was in a terrible funk that started with a 103 fever on May 20.   Her oc ordered another full brain MRI due to her headaches   That came back "all clear" as well, a week and a half ago   I took her in last Thursday for chemo/hydration and I finally got her oc to admit her to the hospital for nutrition and hydration.   She received them that night and was sleeping so I went home to care for our 4 legged kids . We were going to go to the hospital cafeteria the next day and just seconds after she had changed into some street clothes for the trip to the cafeteria, she was having difficulty catching her breath and couldn't speak. Once she caught her breath her speech was slurred. I asked her to stick her tongue out then move it side to side, which she was able to do. I went and got the nurse and told her I thought she was having a stroke. She was, they got on her immediately and they did qick ct scan to ensure she was not bleeding and then administered a TPA blast to knock out the clot(s).   Very successful treatment and she recovered to 100% and was very chatty Friday evening 6-8'ish. She was in icu and I went home.   During the night she was combative and disoriented.   They decided to do the followup brain MRI early ~ 10am as opposed to waiting to 4pm, the 24 hour mark from when the TPA was administered.   The results were NOT good. Cancer on the meninges lining and 3 small tumors on the brain.   I was FLOORED, we JUST had a full brain MRI ONE week prior, and it was CLEAR!!! How could this be???   Well, the answer is the word I am trying to get out with this post:   Last Saturday, they did a CONTRAST MRI and the one done one week ago AND the one done last September were NON contrast MRI's ...   I was told that the contrast type is much better at detecting things like cancer ...   I hope this post can save someone else from our tragedy.   I believe that IF we had had a contrast MRI last year and certainly a week and a half ago we could have dealt with the creep without being where we are now.   They gave her one month max from the date of diagnosis, which was Saturday. It is so widespread the only treatment, whole brain radiation, MAY extend her life a month or so, but at what cost? She wanted dignity, quality of life and she HAD that but her time is up.   PLEASE spread the word, INSIST on a contrast MRI   mjsdad ... trying to cope in Scottsdale, AZ   mods, please move this post to an area that is more appropriate if this is not the best place for this post, thanks!    Sorry to introduce myself this way, but my wife, mjsmom, is heading toward hospice care as soon as a bed opens. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: For mjsmom: MRI options IMPORTANT mjsdad donnabee

Posts.Title: For mjsmom: MRI options IMPORTANT mjsdad donnabee

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2011 03:07PM - edited Jul 22, 2011 03:08PM by mjsdad We thank everyone for their well wishes and prayers I can only hope this info goes out EVERYWHERE. Other forums, mainstream info, everywhere. Please feel free link this to other discussion groups and forums  The cancer is a terrible thing to have but managing it was not that difficult, quality life CAN BE possible when you have ALL the info.  I am in Hospice now with her and I DO NOT want anyone else have to suffer as we are now from what I can only think was missed info. What IF they did one last September, what would they have found? Nothing? I don't know.  The one done two weeks ago? MAYBE we could have started whole brain radiation and she could have had some quality time ... I DON'T KNOW Is it possible that in ONE WEEK this had spread so rapidly??? Again, I do not know  I just DO NOT want anyone else to have a giant surprise like this thrust upon them and not having any options ...
Posts.Title: For mjsmom: MRI options IMPORTANT mjsdad donnabee

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2011 08:41PM mjsdad wrote: mjsmom passed in the middle of the thunder storm we had last night. Fortunately she was able to be with her son and myself ... contrast MRI's ....
